# General Information

I am Ruoxi Li, a graduate student specializing in Biostatistics at Columbia University's Irving Medical Center, focusing on developing machine learning models for fair disease prediction and optimizing clinical trials for diverse populations. 

In terms of technical skills, I primarily utilize R and python for data analysis. Additionally, I have practical experience with SAS and SPSS, allowing me to proficiently handle and analyze data using these tools.

I grew up in Wuhan and received my undergraduate education at one of top medical colleges in China. During the pandemic, I was presented with numerous opportunities to strengthen my skills. This challenging period deepened my commitment to improve health and well-being.
